meanings.definition: Having a flat and even surface.
meanings.sent1: The ground was level and smooth for playing.
meanings.sent2: The table was level, so the cup didn't tip over.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to balance on the level floor but kept slipping comically.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze was level, showing no hint of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The level road stretched out endlessly before them, inviting exploration.

meanings.definition: A position or degree of intensity.
meanings.sent1: His excitement reached a high level when he saw the surprise.
meanings.sent2: The noise level in the room suddenly dropped to a whisper.
meanings.sent3: The level of his enthusiasm for ice cream was unmatched.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room rose to a dangerous level.
meanings.sent5: The level of determination in her eyes was unwavering.

meanings.definition: To make something flat or even.
meanings.sent1: She used a ruler to level the top of the cake.
meanings.sent2: He carefully leveled the ground before building the shed.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to level the playing field by making everyone disappear.
meanings.sent4: The storm leveled the trees, leaving a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter leveled the shelf with precision, ensuring it was perfect.

meanings.definition: A specific floor or story in a building.
meanings.sent1: The party was on the top level of the building.
meanings.sent2: She lived on the ground level of the apartment complex.
meanings.sent3: The level of the library with the history books was her favorite.
meanings.sent4: The basement level was dark and musty, filled with old boxes.
meanings.sent5: The penthouse level offered stunning views of the city skyline.
